channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to resign, according to the parliament’s speaker https://t.co/wkEOj2WyXl
Forget beaches. Miami is all about hedge funds and crypto now. https://t.co/NgCKGxzXp6
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal leaped last year. Here's why so many Americans are relocating there. https://t.co/KjuKZ2z4LZ
Republicans are favored to take control of the House in this year’s midterms, and redistricting has given them a built-in advantage that could span the next 10 years https://t.co/Xza1gbha1f
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/mTWzoQRTBx
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/7OpnJvqHRp
Elena Rybakina defeated Ons Jabeur in the Wimbledon women's final. She is the first tennis player representing Kazakhstan to win a major title. https://t.co/Cz8vg2U1Zx
The Las Vegas Raiders have named Sandra Douglass Morgan president, making her the first Black woman to hold that role in the National Football League https://t.co/wVLwKlGXrG
Inflation-protected U.S. savings bonds are yielding an eye-popping 9.62%—if you can fight through the red tape to actually buy one https://t.co/zRuYwvI8op
Essay: Buying brides is an illegal but long-held practice in China. A video of a woman chained in a shed has brought it to light—and spurred a campaign to stamp it out. https://t.co/hlLTQ5444S

A superyacht reportedly being built for Amazon founder Jeff Bezos won’t be able to sail through the waterways of the Dutch port city of Rotterdam after the company making the vessel withdrew a request to dismantle a historic bridge amid public outcry https://t.co/wTuXr0u4GJ
The U.K. is helping Ukraine turn civilians into soldiers, training new recruits to give Kyiv more manpower along the eastern front with Russia https://t.co/R3dZoeo21t

Elon Musk got approval to connect his Starlink satellite-internet service to planes and boats, but SpaceX is still sparring with rivals over spectrum it uses to reach customers https://t.co/fHgozNrmrF

Many long Covid sufferers are struggling to make ends meet, despite a strong job market. It’s one reason why the economy might not be able to grow as quickly as it otherwise might. https://t.co/h7lxoTC72d
The assassination of Shinzo Abe—just before lunchtime on a busy street corner—has been met with disbelief in a country where few have ever seen a gun drawn, let alone used one https://t.co/Zk7kJicntK
The euro is hurtling toward parity with the dollar for the first time since its early years of existence https://t.co/lYJrK7izVT
An appeals court tossed a $95 million defamation lawsuit brought by former Alabama Supreme Court Chief Justice Roy Moore against comedian Sacha Baron Cohen https://t.co/bB5p9nS9sm
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of next week’s unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/qI56xRmqS2
Twitter’s board says it plans to pursue legal action after Elon Musk said he is seeking to terminate their $44 billion deal https://t.co/yvNebytNpp
Buying a home in America is the least affordable it has been since 2006, new data show https://t.co/vojO39Tv0X
A new Arizona state law will make recording an officer within 8 feet a misdemeanor offense in most instances https://t.co/LgbfMoHFbt
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of next week’s unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/tZ64bAVcAb
California Gov. Gavin Newsom wants the state to make its own insulin to try to lower the cost of the diabetes drug https://t.co/rV7X8UlJ6d

From @WSJopinion: Nearly 600,000 Covid deaths have occurred on President Biden’s watch despite vaccines and better treatments. One lesson is the importance of diverse opinions. Another lesson is that science evolves, writes @AllysiaFinley. https://t.co/XFKZVtnUz7
Twitter’s board says it plans to pursue legal action after Elon Musk said he is seeking to terminate their $44 billion deal https://t.co/in4yVRYwf3
Breaking: Elon Musk is terminating his agreement to buy Twitter https://t.co/Y9VMHIddOy
Elon Musk said he plans to significantly increase child-care benefits at his companies, citing his long-held concern about potential population decline https://t.co/hbEoA92jhF
An appeals court tossed a $95 million defamation lawsuit brought by former Alabama Supreme Court Chief Justice Roy Moore against comedian Sacha Baron Cohen https://t.co/EtieGe8vEK

A superyacht reportedly being built for Amazon founder Jeff Bezos won’t be able to sail through the waterways of the Dutch port city of Rotterdam after the company making the vessel withdrew a request to dismantle a historic bridge amid public outcry https://t.co/lSkFx7mZUw
President Biden is expected to sign an executive order directing agencies to take steps to protect access to reproductive-health care https://t.co/04wkisUBON

Messages filled with personal tributes and shock over the assassination of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe poured in from world leaders, underscoring the alliances he forged during his time as the country’s premier https://t.co/r1lobqyBCy
The U.S. economy added 372,000 jobs in June, extending a streak of strong gains despite signs of slowing economic growth. The jobless rate remained at 3.6%. https://t.co/H1nygdj82G

From @WSJopinion: Few of Japan’s postwar leaders have been as consequential as Shinzo Abe, the retired prime minister who was assassinated Friday at the age of 67. He was a U.S. ally, he tried to revitalize his country at home and abroad. https://t.co/BniR0n88Tf
WWE's Vince McMahon paid out $12 million in settlements to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity over the past 16 years, people familiar say https://t.co/6HHLPmtIxX

From @WSJopinion: Sorry, Mr. President. The party needed you to beat Donald Trump, and you made the mistake of adopting the left’s agenda. Now that you’re down in the polls, you’re expendable. https://t.co/iE2SdgDs3E

Watch: Japan’s former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was killed by a shooter at a campaign event. Footage shows Mr. Abe–the country’s longest serving leader–giving a speech that was interrupted by two loud bangs. https://t.co/Ed9dNy2pqS
Japan's Shinzo Abe championed a revival in the economic and military strength of a country that began to stagnate in the 1990s https://t.co/YQJbWeMR8k
Former Japanese premier Shinzo Abe has died at 67 from gunshot wounds, public broadcaster NHK said. He bolstered the nation’s defense, while struggling to lift its economy. https://t.co/bj6dq4ufFD
From @WSJopinion: President Biden’s actions this year are a textbook example of how to turn policy challenges into a political disaster, writes @KarlRove https://t.co/HCm0E7JVzY
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/VheWdNJd0l https://t.co/nRZv5QcDJc
Live updates: Japan’s leader says former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is in serious condition after he was shot during a speech in Japan https://t.co/L4km7Sc73C
Breaking: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe collapsed during a speech in western Japan as sounds like gunshots were heard at the site, according to local media https://t.co/ExCoxfLqAg
As U.S. companies struggle to entice workers back to offices, the Dutch parliament has approved legislation to establish work-from-home as a legal right https://t.co/p7i29vMGzF
U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson's resignation will disappoint many in Ukraine, where the leader had won wide admiration for his deep support of Kyiv’s fight against Russia https://t.co/gvMvTWL4bV

The news that Boris Johnson will resign disappointed many in Ukraine, where the British prime minister has won countless fans—from the country’s leaders to ordinary citizens—for his support for Kyiv’s fight against Russia’s invasion https://t.co/bn4unFzDA4

Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin was sentenced to more than 20 years in federal prison after pleading guilty to violating George Floyd’s civil rights. He will serve the sentence concurrently with his state sentence for second degree murder. https://t.co/XDO7qbGduz
A police officer had the Uvalde school shooter in his rifle sight before he entered the school but didn’t fire, according to a new report https://t.co/6Z8ANslEzV
Essay: President Biden has promised to support Ukraine for “as long as it takes.” But U.S. weapons stockpiles are low and production capacity is limited. https://t.co/rC7FfwOJeN

Breaking: Former Theranos president Sunny Balwani, the former top lieutenant to founder Elizabeth Holmes, was convicted on all 12 criminal charges that he helped conduct a yearslong fraud scheme at the blood-testing startup https://t.co/U7vPoysiwQ
Mortgage rates recorded their largest decline this year. The average rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage fell to 5.30%. https://t.co/fKLlEXsV4F
